docs.snippet: In a story Oct. 15 about a recall of defective tires made by GITI Tire and Continental Tire, The Associated Press reported erroneously that it affected about 265,000 vehicles. The recall affects about 265,000 tires, not vehicles....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Oct. 15 about a recall of defective tires made by GITI Tire and Continental Tire, The Associated Press reported erroneously that it affected about 265,000 vehicles. The recall affects about 265,000 tires, not vehicles.

docs.snippet: Francisco Lindor drove in what became the winning run in the third inning, and reliever Andrew Miller put on an overpowering display of pitching late in the contest as the Cleveland Indians beat the Toronto Blue Jays 2-1 in Game Two of the America...
docs.lead_paragraph: Francisco Lindor drove in what became the winning run in the third inning, and reliever Andrew Miller put on an overpowering display of pitching late in the contest as the Cleveland Indians beat the Toronto Blue Jays 2-1 in Game Two of the American League Championship Series in Cleveland on Saturday.

headline.main: Indians Beat Blue Jays Again to Take 2-0 Series Lead

docs.snippet: LPGA chief Mike Whan says the Tour will back golf authorities no matter what decision they make about hosting the 2017 US Women's Open at a course owned by presidential nominee Donald Trump amid a storm over sexually aggressive comments he made ab...
docs.lead_paragraph: LPGA chief Mike Whan says the Tour will back golf authorities no matter what decision they make about hosting the 2017 US Women's Open at a course owned by presidential nominee Donald Trump amid a storm over sexually aggressive comments he made about women.

headline.main: LPGA Happy to Let USGA Make Trump Course Decision

docs.snippet: Tom Herman’s rite of kissing and hugging his players has earned praise from psychologists who say players are motivated by a desire to be in connected communities....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tom Herman’s rite of kissing and hugging his players has earned praise from psychologists who say players are motivated by a desire to be in connected communities.
docs.abstract: University of Houston football coach Tom Herman upsets sport's traditional association with hypermasculinity by frequently kissing and hugging his players and encouraging other forms of physical affection; claims not to understand why his approach, which psychologists say fosters  bond successful groups need to thrive, has been controversial.

headline.main: Houston’s Coach Pecks Away at Football’s Macho Culture, a Kiss at a Time
headline.print_headline: Houston Coach Pecks Away at Macho Stereotype
